name: Sage
properties: Traditional herb for stuffings and root vegetables
Pairs well with mushrooms and winter vegetables
Contains compounds with potential cognitive benefits
benefits: Sage is a powerful anti-inflammatory herb with antioxidant and antimicrobial properties. It has been traditionally associated with cognitive support. Works particularly well with mushroom-based dishes, winter squash, and sweet potatoes. Both fresh and ground forms are used in plant-based cooking.
amount: 1/2 teaspoon fresh chopped sage or 1/2 teaspoon dried/ground sage per recipe (4 servings)
